terms.definition: term that is not using any of previously-defined terms
the objectively existing world in the broadest sense. {Primitive notion}
undividible {elementary particle}, known at the moment
any substance in {reality} that has {mass} and {volume}
something that can be seen as separate from any other objects. {Primitive notion}
a common characteristic that does not exist by itself, but the possession of which can be attributed to many different {entities}
act of assigning some {number} or {category} to {property}, with some well-defined, reproducible procedure
some {number} or {category} that has meaning in specific context
well defined and not changing {value} or {abstract item}
strict rule that for each {entity} from some {set} X assigns exactly one {entity} from some {set} Y
{function} of a {system} of the dependent variables, the {value} of which remains {constant} along each trajectory of the {system}
{value} or {category} received as a result of {measurement} or {calculation} of some {property}
some fixed {set} of {properties} and {property values}, describing specific {entity}
ability of an {entity} to interact with {reality}
{existing} {entity}
{entity} that does not {exist} by itself, but is the result of a generalization of other {entities}
{set}, all {entities} of which fit some predefined rule
{property} of {physical object}, which is possible to {measure}
group of any {entities}
{set}, all {entities} of which are contained in another {set}
{set} of interacting {physical objecs}
{ordered} {set} of {entities}
continuous {sequence} of {existence} and changes occuring in {reality}
some extent in which {entities} can take some different places
not empty {set} of independent {dimensions}
part of {space} occupied by some {physical object}
simple {physical object} with {measurable} {coordinates} and maybe {volume}, and other {properties}
a {particle} that is not composed of other {particles}
{set} of {propery values}, describing unique place in {space}
{position}
{abstract entity}, that can be described with it's {position} only
{set} of interacting {abstract entities}, that behaves similar to some {system}
{space} having three {dimensions}
{model} that combines the {three dimensional space} and one {dimension} of {time} into a single four-dimensional {space}
change of {physical object} or {system} that has specific point in {spacetime}
series of {measurable} changes over {time} that occur in {system}

influence by which one {event}, {process}, {state}, or {entity} (a cause) contributes to the production of another {event}, {process}, {state}, or {entity} (an effect) where the cause is partly responsible for the effect, and the effect is partly dependent on the cause
